AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.marijuana: substance for distribution, weighing between 100 and 1,000 kilograms
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.large white Ford pickup truck: vehicle involved in the stop by United States/Mexican Border Patrol, suspected of being a lead car, with equipment including tool boxes, a spare gas tank, and an air tank in its bed, bearing a Kansas license plate, exhibited unusual driving behavior near Marathon, Texas, and was stopped 70 or 80 miles from the United States/Mexican Border, containing two unloaded handguns, subject of a motion to suppress evidence, driven by Brignoni-Ponce Jacquinot, traveled through an area very close to the United States/Mexican Border prior to the stop, with proximity to the border being a factor in the stop, and was seen leaving Big Bend National Park early on a Sunday morning, deviating from typical traffic patterns, raising suspicion due to its unusual departure time, slowed dramatically to fifteen miles per hour below the speed limit, remained stopped at a stop sign for five seconds, made an unusual turn and traveled toward Alpine, Texas on Highway 118, displayed indirect travel route from Big Bend National Park to Alpine, Texas, did not have a park sticker on its windshield
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.alien smuggling cases: cases involving the smuggling of aliens
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.narcotics cases: cases involving narcotics, including a recent operation in the Alpine, Texas area destined for locations in Kansas, and related to a drug trafficking offense, with evidence that a temporal and spatial relation existed between the weapon, the drug trafficking activity, and the defendant
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.alien: individuals being smuggled, potentially involved in suspicious activity near the United States/Mexican Border, and possibly passengers in vehicles stopped by border patrol
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.contraband: suspected cargo in the load car
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.late model four-door sedan: vehicle observed by United States/Mexican Border Patrol, carrying an older Anglo couple and bearing a Big Bend National Park registration receipt and a Mississippi license plate
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.two unloaded handguns: dangerous weapons found in the large white Ford pickup truck, possessed in connection with a drug offense, with evidence showing a temporal and spatial relation to the drug trafficking activity
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.U.S. District Court: concluded that the driver's behavior added to the United States/Mexican Border Patrol agents' reasonable suspicion, considered indirect route as a factor supporting reasonable suspicion, and applied a two-level increase in the offense level for a drug trafficking offense due to possession of a dangerous weapon
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States/Mexican Border Patrol: agency that stopped the large white Ford pickup truck and observed its unusual behavior, draws inferences from historical facts and events leading up to a stop, with burden of proof to show by a preponderance of the evidence that a temporal and spatial relation existed between the weapon, the drug trafficking activity, and the defendant
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Brignoni-Ponce Jacquinot: driver of the large white Ford pickup truck, who asserts that the proximity-to-the-United States/Mexican Border Patrol factor should weigh against a finding of reasonable suspicion, and notes that Texas Highway 385 is also a major highway used by thousands of visitors to Big Bend National Park, argues that it was not suspicious for the large white Ford pickup truck to slow down after Andrew P. Graham followed it
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States/Mexican Border: border near which the large white Ford pickup truck was stopped, with the vehicle having traveled through an area very close to the border prior to the stop
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Agent Andrew P. Graham: testified about the large white Ford pickup truck's behavior, including slowing down and making an unusual turn, with evidence used to support a two-level increase in the offense level for a drug trafficking offense due to possession of a dangerous weapon
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.tool boxes: equipment found in the large white Ford pickup truck
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.a gas tank: equipment found in the large white Ford pickup truck
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.an air tank: equipment found in the large white Ford pickup truck
